channel.title: wiping pc help!
channel.description:
I'm going to wipe my PC soon what should, I do so far I have a free copy of kildisk on a CD should that be enough to wipe the drive and any viruses still on it. Also I want to reinstall my PC on the same hard drive after this. Another question as well should I buy the full version of kill disk.
Here's the link [url]https://www.killdisk.com/downloadfree.htm[/url]

item.title: wiping pc help!
item.dc:creator: Guf
item.description:
Just to stir some more, formatting the drive is enough as long as the virus doesn’t live in the boot sector… But any decent AV software checks for that too - I’d suggest an offline check tho - once you’ve booted from a drive there’s no sure method of knowing what’s hiding on it.

Read full topic

item.description:

But some viruses make transfer you from the Malwarebytes website to some more viruses.

item.title: wiping pc help!
item.dc:creator: adeckofhands
item.description:
Ahh this thread made me laugh so much.
Right…

When you format your hard drive you will delete all the data on it. a virus is data. so once you format it wont be there any more.

3rd party applications are great for formatting and get rid of data securely so it cannot be recovered, but this is only needed if you are going to be getting rid of your hard drive or have something to hide. So for your purposes just use the built in windows formatter on the windows installation disk.

Once you wipe your entire drive with the windows installer and reinstall windows. you will have NO viruses. At this point please download and install an anti virus like AVG or Avast or one of your choice if you don’t want to take my recommendations.

Congratulations. You now have a computer with NO viruses. Watch what your downloading and what you are putting into your PC.

Read full topic

Formatting to get rid of virues is like getting rid of a cockroach with a nuke.

The viruses are definitely not coming back if you don’t have any backups.

edit: unless you also have viruses on a flash drive…

item.title: wiping pc help!
item.dc:creator: Madcat1030
item.description:
Run: cmd.exe
Type: format C:

Lol. Or just slip in the OS disk you have and choose to install the OS, during the startup sequence, you’ll be allowed to work with partitions, during which you must format any parts of the harddrive (in your case, the whole thing) going to be used.

I wouldn’t recommend using any drive-wiping program, cuz it seems mostly superfluous.

I just recently wiped my old computer, and I was a little confused when some drivers I hadn’t expected to survive still existed. Turned out some of them were hardcoded into the mobo or something along those lines. There’s no way to write data (viruses) there, so it’s not at all a deficiency of the wipe, or can it be reached by any other wipe without possibly fucking your computer over, even if it were possible.

EDIT:
Oh, and what he’s saying about smashing cockroaches with artillery rounds is that: This is mega-overkill. Unless you’ve been very… active in your fwaping recently, and your harddrive is just filled with general death and chaos.

Edit edit:
Now, if you’re whiping your computer to hide something, you’d have to take some extra steps. Because “deleting” data always ends in some wasted energy (in this case useless storage/data) that could possibly be re-pieced together by somebody who really wanted to get that data. You’d want to refill your harddrive with random crap (a self-propagating text file or reproducing WoW shortcut [that happened to me, my worldofwarcraft shortcut copied and pasted itself enough times to fill my entire harddrive with a bunch of 1.7 kb files of doom. The installer was fucked]) would do), then re-format again. Do that four times and your computer is wiped to professional/political standards.

Read full topic

item.title: wiping pc help!
item.dc:creator: gwgmer
item.description:
I personally like Avira. It works, and it’s a lot less bloated than some of the other antivirus programs.
https://www.avira.com/en/pages/index.php

As for getting rid of viruses, you can wipe your HDD, but it’s like smashing a cockroach with an artillery round.

Get antivirus, run it.
Open your command prompt and run these two things for good measure:
chkdsk /f and sfc /scannow
Stop downloading CP.
Problem fixed.

Read full topic

item.title: wiping pc help!
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Viruses are files themselves… if you do a standard format (with the windows installation cd, for example), the viruses will be wiped, just like ALL other files on your drive. Sure, the FBI could recover the viruses on your hard drive, probably, but that’s beside the point.

Edit: oh, and install an antivirus next time (I recommend AVG free, it’s free and it works perfectly fine)

Read full topic

item.title: wiping pc help!
item.dc:creator: Will89
item.description:
Just do whatever you want. Seriously, if you’re so Hell-bent on Killdisk, just use the damned thing already. It will take longer and you’ll basically get the same results than if you just did a regular Windows installation format, but whatever, I’m tired of trying to save you some time when you won’t listen. So, for the umpteenth time, it doesn’t freakin’ matter!

Read full topic

item.title: wiping pc help!
item.dc:creator: The_Minotaur
item.description:
If you want to irreversibly format your computer, and everything on it, then leave it in a room with a 5 year old, complete wipe for you for free.

But seriously though, when you format the drive with Windows then it will delete everything on it, but 3rd party software will probably keep something of itself on there which by the sounds of it you don’t want. So just format the drive, and reinstall Windows.

If a virus is the reason for this, then download AVG Anti-Virus software, it will find and remove any viruses with no formatting necessary.

Read full topic

item.title: wiping pc help!
item.dc:creator: baconeggs
item.description:
So if you’re not backing anything up and you want everything deleted, why not use a magnet?

Or use the FBI data securing method:

  1. Wipe the disk with a magnet

  2. Overwrite it with random ones and zeros 600 times

  3. Crush the disk to bits and sell them to be used in mortar

  4. Buy a new HDD

item.title: wiping pc help!
item.dc:creator: Will89
item.description:
Oy… Is a virus the only reason you’re formatting? This might sound crazy, but some people have been able to get rid of such things more effectively by using something called “anti-virus software”. Cutting edge, I know… O_o

Seriously though, if you backup your virus-infected files and then format your drive (no matter what software you use), it will return once you reload your backup files. So again, it doesn’t matter what you use. We already told you the format tool included with the Windows installer is good enough, so stop asking us about different programs and make up your own damn mind. SHIT!

Read full topic

item.title: wiping pc help!
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
First of all, there is no difference how you format the drive, infact I think kildisk would be less effective than the built in windows CD format tool.

Also, if you think that viruses get wiped like that you’re an idiot.

If you have viruses that infect files, no matter how many times you wipe, as soon as you copy old files back on the drive, the virus becomes active again.

You should find a program that detects the infected files and recovers them automatically.

Read full topic
